Type.Name: Directory
Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.returns: a containing the files in the directory.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void GetEntries (Gnome.Vfs.Uri uri, Gnome.Vfs.FileInfoOptions options, uint itemsPerNotification, int priority, Gnome.Vfs.AsyncDirectoryLoadCallback callback);

Docs.summary: Asynchronously load a directory from with the specified .
Docs.param: a
for loading the directory.
the number of entries to read in the directory per notification.
a value from to (normally should be ) indicating the priority to assign this job in allocating threads from the thread pool.
a to be called when the specified number of entries have been read or the operation is complete.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void GetEntries (string uri, Gnome.Vfs.FileInfoOptions options, uint itemsPerNotification, int priority, Gnome.Vfs.AsyncDirectoryLoadCallback callback);

for loading the directory.
the number of entries to read in the directory per notification.
a value from to (normally should be ) indicating the priority to assign this job in allocating threads from the thread pool.

Docs.summary: Delete . must be an empty directory.
Docs.param: of the directory to be removed.

Docs.summary: Remove uri. Uri must be an empty directory.
Docs.param: URI of the directory to be removed.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Gnome.Vfs.Result Create (Gnome.Vfs.Uri uri, Gnome.Vfs.FilePermissions perm);

Docs.summary: Create a directory at . Only succeeds if a file or directory does not already exist at .
Docs.param: of the directory to be created.
Unix-style permissions for the newly created directory.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Gnome.Vfs.Result Create (string uri, Gnome.Vfs.FilePermissions perm);

Docs.summary: Create a directory at uri. Only succeeds if a file or directory does not already exist at the uri.
Docs.param: URI of the directory to be created.
Unix-style permissions for the newly created directory.
